_comment: Created by ianb on 20/03/2015 10:28:16 using v2.5
title: How do medication safety incidents reported change in acute and mental health trusts over time?
analysis_commentary: The number of incidents in both acute and mental health trusts has been increasing over time. In acute trusts there were around 89 incidents reported per 10,000 admissions in 2013/14 while in mental health trusts it was 24 per 10,000 bed days. However, as the first chart shows there has been a decline in the rate of incidents that cause severe harm or death. So while the rate of incidents reported is increasing, it appears that there are less incidents that result in severe harm or death, some incidents may be classified as less severe or a combination of both.
data_source: National Patient Safety Agency, National Reporting and Learning System
